div1.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your Department of the 2nd August last (forwarded through our Minister President M le Baron de Stein to this Department), in which you do me the honor to inform me that His Majesty King Leopold II the august sovereign of the independent State of the Congo, has deigned to nominate you as General Administrator of the Department of Foreign Affairs of that state.

2 Your Excellency is further pleased
His Excellency E. Van Eetvelde General Administrator of the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Independent State of the Congo Brussels Belgium.
pleased to inform me of the desire on your part to see established between the two states agreeable relations of friendship which it is hoped will be profitable to them, and also to assure me that nothing on your part shall be neglected to give them this double character.

3. In reply permit me to assure you Sir of the pleasure it gives this Department to be thus brought into friendly intercourse with the Government of the New African State, and that my Government feliciates itself upon the signal evidence of good regard and friendly feeling existent on the part of the Government of the Free State of the Congo (as evinced in your above cited Despatch) towards our Republic. The expression of your good wish and desire for friendly confidence are heartily reciprocated, and I shall take pleasure in endeavoring to give a practical
practical form to the same.
4. It affords me therefore much pleasure to offer you my congratulations on your nomination to this important position and to add thereto the assurance of the high consideration and esteem with which

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your Obedient Servant
E.J. Barclay
